subject: Gardening
title: Ant Bodyguard Partnerships
description: A fast breakdown of Ant Bodyguard Partnerships for builders.

hook.text: Bullhorn acacia trees house, feed, and pay ant coloniesâ€”and the ants kill anything that touches the tree.

buildup.text: Hollow thorns provide shelter. Nectar glands provide sugar. Protein-rich Beltian bodies feed ant larvae.

discovery.text: In return, ants attack herbivores, clear competing plants, and even prune encroaching vines from the canopy.

twist.text: Remove the ants and the acacia dies within months. Remove the acacia and the ant colony collapses. Total codependence.

climax.text: This mutualism is so tight that neither species can survive alone. They've become one functional organism.

punchline.text: Some trees pay rentâ€”in sugarâ€”to tiny soldiers.

quiz.question: What happens if ants are removed from a bullhorn acacia?
options: The tree grows faster without sharing resources
The tree dies within months without ant protection
Other insects take over the ant colonies' role
